articles.headline: Problems Pile Up for Boeing as 737 Max Delays Continue
articles.snippet: The timing is as precarious as ever. Global regulators still need to approve a software fix.
articles.abstract: The timing is as precarious as ever. Global regulators still need to approve a software fix.
articles.lead_paragraph: The return of Boeing’s 737 Max appears to be slipping. Again.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Natalie Kitroeff

articles.headline: Trump Signs Hong Kong Democracy Legislation, Angering China
articles.snippet: The measure, which could lead to sanctions on Chinese officials for cracking down on the protesters, drew bipartisan support from Congress.
articles.abstract: The measure, which could lead to sanctions on Chinese officials for cracking down on the protesters, drew bipartisan support from Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump on Wednesday signed tough legislation that authorizes sanctions on Chinese and Hong Kong officials responsible for human rights abuses in Hong Kong, signaling support for pro-democracy activists and escalating tensions with Beijing as Mr. Trump tries to negotiate a trade deal with Chinese leaders.
articles.byline: By Emily Cochrane, Edward Wong and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: Broken Promises and Debt Pile Up as Loan Forgiveness Goes Astray
articles.snippet: A federal loan forgiveness program made a promise to students: Stick with your vital but low-wage professions and your debts will be wiped clean. Then they weren’t.
articles.abstract: A federal loan forgiveness program made a promise to students: Stick with your vital but low-wage professions and your debts will be wiped clean. Then they weren’t.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Congress created a student loan forgiveness program in 2007, lawmakers wanted to draw people to vital but relatively low-paid careers with a promise: after a decade, if borrowers faithfully paid their debts and pursued their work, they would have the remainder of their student loans written off.
articles.byline: By Erica L. Green and Stacy Cowley

articles.headline: When Is a Star Not Always a Star? When It’s an Online Review
articles.snippet: Customer reviews are incredibly important in e-commerce, but they can be unreliable or downright dishonest.
articles.abstract: Customer reviews are incredibly important in e-commerce, but they can be unreliable or downright dishonest.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the world of e-commerce, the online review is king, the internet’s answer to walking into a store and trying out a product for yourself.

articles.headline: China Condemns U.S. Over Hong Kong. That Won’t Stop Trade Talks.
articles.snippet: Legislation signed by Trump poses a direct challenge to Beijing’s rule, but trade and the softening Chinese economy present bigger problems.
articles.abstract: Legislation signed by Trump poses a direct challenge to Beijing’s rule, but trade and the softening Chinese economy present bigger problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China vented on Thursday after President Trump signed new human rights legislation covering the protest-wracked city of Hong Kong. It denounced the new law as illegal interference in its own affairs. It summoned the American ambassador for the second time in a week. It vowed retaliation.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher, Javier C. Hernández and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Donald Trump Jr., Debut Author, Sees Sales Bolstered by G.O.P. Allies
articles.snippet: Orders from the Republican Party and other conservative groups helped push Mr. Trump’s best-selling book, records show.
articles.abstract: Orders from the Republican Party and other conservative groups helped push Mr. Trump’s best-selling book, records show.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boxes began arriving in early November at the Phoenix headquarters of Turning Point USA, a conservative student group with ties to the Trump family.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore and Alexandra Alter

articles.headline: O.K., Mayor: Why 37-Year-Old Pete Buttigieg Is Attracting Boomers
articles.snippet: Calling himself the “retirement guy” and pitching a “Gray New Deal,” Mr. Buttigieg has crafted a message that resonates among older white Americans, helping him rocket past other candidates in some polls.
articles.abstract: Calling himself the “retirement guy” and pitching a “Gray New Deal,” Mr. Buttigieg has crafted a message that resonates among older white Americans, helping him rocket past other candidates in some polls.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENISON, Iowa — Pete Buttigieg likes a crisp white button-down — no fuss, no flash — and his favorite novel is by a man who died in 1941.
